analyzed: thera vāda vinaya
translated: The Pāṭimokkha of the Theravāda Vinaya

analyzed: mahāvibhaṅga  pācittiyakaṇḍa  sappāṇaka vagga
translated: The Great Analysis🔽The Chapter on Offences of Wrong Conduct

analyzed: ūnavīsati vassa sikkhāpada
translated: The sub-chapter on living beings🔽The training rule on less than twenty years

original: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā rājagahe viharati veḷuvane kalandakanivāpe.
analyzed: tena samayena buddhaḥ bhagavā rājagahe viharati veḷuvane kalandakanivāpe
translated: At one time the Buddha was staying at Rājagaha in the Bamboo Grove, the squirrel sanctuary.

original: Tena kho pana samayena rājagahe sattarasavaggiyā dārakā sahāyakā honti.
analyzed: tena khalu pana samayena rājagahe satta rasa vaggiyāḥ dārakāḥ sahāyakāḥ honti
translated: At that time in Rājagaha there were seventeen boys who were friends.

analyzed: upāli dārako tesam pāmokkhaḥ hoti
translated: Upāli was the chief of them.

analyzed: atha kho upālissa mātā pitūnam etat ahosi
translated: Then Upāli’s parents thought,

original: “kena nu kho upāyena upāli amhākaṁ accayena sukhañca jīveyya na ca kilameyyā”ti?
analyzed: kena nu khalu upāyena upāli amhākam accayena sukham ca jīveyya na ca kilameyya ati
translated: “By what means can Upāli live happily after we’re gone, without working?”

analyzed: atha kho upālissa mātā pitūnam etat ahosi
translated: Then they thought,

original: “sace kho upāli lekhaṁ sikkheyya, evaṁ kho upāli amhākaṁ accayena sukhañca jīveyya, na ca kilameyyā”ti.
analyzed: sace kho upāli lekham sikkheyya evam kho upāli amhākam accayena sukham ca jīveyya na ca kilameyya ati
translated: “If Upāli learns writing, he’ll be able to live happily after we’re gone, without working.”

analyzed: atha kho upālissa mātā pitūnam etat ahosi
translated: Then they thought,

original: “sace kho upāli lekhaṁ sikkhissati, aṅguliyo dukkhā bhavissanti.
analyzed: sace kho upāli lekham sikkhissati aṅguliyaḥ dukkhāḥ bhavissanti
translated: “If Upāli learns writing, his fingers will hurt.

original: Sace kho upāli gaṇanaṁ sikkheyya, evaṁ kho upāli amhākaṁ accayena sukhañca jīveyya na ca kilameyyā”ti.
analyzed: sace kho upāli gaṇanam sikkheyya evam kho upāli amhākam accayena sukham ca jīveyya na ca kilameyya ati
translated: If he were to learn to count, he could live comfortably and not have to work hard.”

analyzed: atha kho upālissa mātā pitūnam etat ahosi
translated: Then his parents thought,

original: “sace kho upāli gaṇanaṁ sikkhissati, urassa dukkho bhavissati.
analyzed: sace kho upāli gaṇanam sikkhissati urassa dukkhaḥ bhavissati
translated: “If he learns to count, he’ll have chest pains.

original: Sace kho upāli rūpaṁ sikkheyya, evaṁ kho upāli amhākaṁ accayena sukhañca jīveyya na ca kilameyyā”ti.
analyzed: sace kho upāli rūpam sikkheyya evam kho upāli amhākam accayena sukham ca jīveyya na ca kilameyya ati
translated: If he were to learn to read, he could live comfortably and not have to work hard.”

analyzed: atha kho upālissa mātā pitūnam etat ahosi
translated: Then his parents thought,

original: “sace kho upāli rūpaṁ sikkhissati, akkhīni dukkhā bhavissanti.
analyzed: sace kho upāli rūpam sikkhissati akkhīni dukkhā bhavissanti
translated: “If he learns to read, his eyes will hurt.

original: Ime kho samaṇā sakyaputtiyā sukhasīlā sukhasamācārā subhojanāni bhuñjitvā nivātesu sayanesu sayanti.
analyzed: ime kho samaṇā sakya puttiyā sukha sīlā sukha samācārā su bhojanāni bhuñjitvā nivātesu sayanesu sayanti
translated: These Sakyan monastics have a pleasant spiritual life. They eat good food and sleep in beds sheltered from the wind.

original: Sace kho upāli samaṇesu sakyaputtiyesu pabbajeyya, evaṁ kho upāli amhākaṁ accayena sukhañca jīveyya, na ca kilameyyā”ti.
analyzed: sace kho upāli samaṇesu sakyaputtiyesu pabbajeyya evam kho upāli amhākam accayena sukham ca jīveyya na ca kilameyya ati
translated: If he were to go forth with the Sakyan monastics, he could live comfortably and not have to work hard.”

original: Assosi kho upālidārako mātāpitūnaṁ imaṁ kathāsallāpaṁ.
analyzed: assosi kho upāli dārakaḥ mātā pitūnam imam kathā sallāpa
translated: Upāli overheard this conversation between his parents.

original: Atha kho upālidārako yena te dārakā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā te dārake etadavoca—
analyzed: atha khalu upāli dārakaḥ yena te dārakā tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā te dārake etat avoca
translated: Upāli went to the other boys and said,

analyzed: etha maya ayyā samaṇesu sakyaputtiyesu pabbajissāma ati
translated: “Come, let’s go forth with the Sakyan monastics.”

original: “Sace kho tvaṁ, ayya, pabbajissasi, evaṁ mayampi pabbajissāmā”ti.
analyzed: sace kho tva ayya pabbajissasi evam mayam pi pabbajissāma ati
translated: “If you go forth, we’ll go forth too.”

original: Atha kho te dārakā ekamekassa mātāpitaro upasaṅkamitvā etadavocuṁ—
analyzed: atha kho te dārakāḥ ekam ekassa mātā pitaraḥ upasaṅkamitvā etat avocuḥ
translated: They then went to their parents and said,

analyzed: anujānātha mam agārasmai anagāriyam pabbajjāya ati
translated: “Please give me permission to go forth from the household life into homelessness.”

analyzed: atha khalu tesam dārakānam mātā pitaraḥ
translated: Their parents thought,

original: “sabbepime dārakā samānacchandā kalyāṇādhippāyā”ti anujāniṁsu.🔽Te bhikkhū upasaṅkamitvā pabbajjaṁ yāciṁsu.
analyzed: sabbe pi me dārakā samāna chandā kalyāṇa adhippāyā ati  te bhikkhū upasaṅkamitvā pabbajjam yācisu
translated: “All these boys have the same wish and the same intention.” And they gave their permission.🔽They then went to the monks and asked for the going forth.

analyzed: te bhikkhū pabbājesum upasampādesu
translated: The monks gave them the going forth and the full ordination.

analyzed: te rattiyā paccūsa samayam paccuṭṭhāya rodanti
translated: Early in the morning they got up and cried,

analyzed: yāgum detha bhattam detha khādanīyam detha ati
translated: “Give us rice porridge! Give us a meal! Give us fresh food!”

analyzed: bhikkhū evam āhasu
translated: The monks said,

analyzed: āgametha āvuso yāva ratti vibhāyati
translated: “Wait, Venerables, until it’s light.

original: Sace yāgu bhavissati, pivissatha.🔽Sace bhattaṁ bhavissati, bhuñjissatha.
analyzed: sace yāgu bhavissati pivissatha  sace bhattam bhavissati bhuñjissatha
translated: If there’s rice porridge, you can drink it.🔽If there’s a meal, you can eat it.

analyzed: sace khādanīyam bhavissati khādissatha
translated: If there’s fresh food, you can eat it.

original: No ce bhavissati yāgu vā bhattaṁ vā khādanīyaṁ vā, piṇḍāya caritvā bhuñjissathā”ti.
analyzed: no ce bhavissati yāgu vā bhattam vā khādanīyam vā piṇḍāya caritvā bhuñjissatha ati
translated: If there’s no rice porridge, no meal, and no fresh food, you can go wandering for alms.”

original: Evampi kho te bhikkhū bhikkhūhi vuccamānā rodantiyeva—
analyzed: evam pi kho te bhikkhū bhikkhūhi vuccamānāḥ rodantiyā iva
translated: But even though the monks were told in this way, they still cried,

original: “yāguṁ detha, bhattaṁ detha, khādanīyaṁ dethā”ti.🔽Senāsanaṁ ūhadantipi ummihantipi.
analyzed: yāgum detha bhattam detha khādanīyam detha ati  senāsanam ūhadantipi ummihantipi
translated: saying, “Give us rice porridge! Give us a meal! Give us fresh food!”🔽They carried the beds and benches outside and left them there.

original: Assosi kho bhagavā rattiyā paccūsasamayaṁ paccuṭṭhāya dārakasaddaṁ.
analyzed: assosi kho bhagavā rattiyā paccūsa samayam paccuṭṭhāya dāraka sadda
translated: Early in the morning the Buddha got up and heard the sound of children.

analyzed: sutvānaḥ āyasmantam ānandam āmantesi
translated: He asked Venerable Ānanda,

analyzed: kim nu kho saḥ ānanda dāraka saddo ti
translated: “Ānanda, what’s that sound of children?”

original: Atha kho āyasmā ānando bhagavato etamatthaṁ ārocesi.
analyzed: atha kho āyasmai ānandaḥ bhagavataḥ etam attham ārocesi
translated: Ānanda told him what had happened.

original: Atha kho bhagavā etasmiṁ nidāne etasmiṁ pakaraṇe bhikkhusaṅghaṁ sannipātāpetvā bhikkhū paṭipucchi—
analyzed: atha kho bhagavā etasmim nidāne etasmim pakaraṇe bhikkhu saṅgham sannipātāpetvā bhikkhū paṭipucchi
translated: The Buddha then had the Sangha gathered and questioned the monks:

original: “saccaṁ kira, bhikkhave, bhikkhū jānaṁ ūnavīsativassaṁ puggalaṁ upasampādentī”ti?
analyzed: saccam kira bhikkhave bhikkhū jānam ūnavīsati vassam puggalam upasampādenti iti
translated: “Is it true, monks, that you do this?”

analyzed: sat ca bhagavān ati
translated: “It’s true, Sir.”

analyzed: vigarahi buddhaḥ bhagavān pe
translated: The Buddha rebuked them …

original: kathañhi nāma te, bhikkhave, moghapurisā jānaṁ ūnavīsativassaṁ puggalaṁ upasampādessanti.🔽Ūnakavīsativasso, bhikkhave, puggalo akkhamo hoti sītassa uṇhassa jighacchāya pipāsāya
analyzed: katham hi nāma te bhikkhave mogha purisāḥ jānam ūnavīsati vassam puggalam upasampādessanti  ūnaka vīsati vassaḥ bhikkhave puggalaḥ akkhamaḥ hoti sītassa uṇhassa jighacchāya pipāsāya
translated: “How can those foolish men give the full ordination to a person who’s less than twenty years old?

analyzed: ḍa sama kasa vāta ātapa sarīsapa samphassānam duruttānam durāgatānam vacana pathānam uppannāna
translated: A person who’s less than twenty years old can’t endure cold and heat; hunger and thirst; horseflies, mosquitoes, wind, and the burning sun; creeping animals and insects; and rude and unwelcome speech.

original: sārīrikānaṁ vedanānaṁ dukkhānaṁ tibbānaṁ kharānaṁ kaṭukānaṁ asātānaṁ amanāpānaṁ pāṇaharānaṁ
analyzed: sārīrikānam vedanānam dukkhānam tibbānam kharānam kaṭukānam asātānam amanāpānam pāṇa harānam
translated: He can’t endure bodily feelings that are painful, severe, sharp, and destructive of life.

analyzed: an adhivāsaka jātikaḥ hoti
translated: He’s not the sort of person who can endure.

original: Vīsativassova kho, bhikkhave, puggalo khamo hoti sītassa uṇhassa …pe…
analyzed: vīsati vassā uva kho bhikkhave puggalo khamaḥ hoti sītassa uṇhassa pe
translated: But a person who’s twenty years old can endure cold and heat; hunger and thirst; horseflies, mosquitoes, wind, and the burning sun; creeping animals and insects; and rude and unwelcome speech.🔽He can endure bodily feelings that are painful, severe, sharp, and destructive of life.

analyzed: adhivāsaka jātikaḥ hoti
translated: He’s the sort of person who can endure.🔽Monks, this rule should be taken as read …”

analyzed: na ita bhikkhave appasannānam vā pasādāya pe
translated: … and after rebuking them … he gave a teaching and addressed the monks:

original: evañca pana, bhikkhave, imaṁ sikkhāpadaṁ uddiseyyātha—
analyzed: evam ca pana bhikkhave imam sikkhāpadam uddiseyyātha
translated: And so, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:

original: “Yo pana bhikkhu jānaṁ ūnavīsativassaṁ puggalaṁ upasampādeyya, so ca puggalo anupasampanno, te ca bhikkhū gārayhā, idaṁ tasmiṁ pācittiyan”ti.
analyzed: yaḥ pana bhikkhu jānam ūnavīsati vassam puggalam upasampādeyya saḥ ca puggalaḥ an upasampannaḥ te ca bhikkhū gārayhāḥ idam tasmim pācittiyanti
translated: ‘If a monk gives the full ordination to a person he knows is less than twenty years old, that person is not ordained and those monks are blameworthy. And there is an offense entailing confession for that monk.’”

analyzed: yaḥ panāti
translated: If a monk:

analyzed: yaḥ ya ādisaḥ pe
translated: if he is such and such.

original: bhikkhūti🔽…pe… ayaṁ imasmiṁ atthe adhippeto bhikkhūti.
analyzed: bhikkhū ti  pe ayam imasmin atthe adhippetaḥ bhikkhu iti
translated: Monk:🔽the meaning is as in the previous rule.

analyzed: jānāti nāma
translated: Knows:

original: sāmaṁ vā jānāti, aññe vā tassa ārocenti, so vā āroceti.
analyzed: sāmam vā jānāti aññe vā tassa ārocenti saḥ vā āroceti
translated: if he finds out by himself or if others tell him or if the person tells him.

analyzed: ūnavīsativassaḥ nāma
translated: Less than twenty years old:

analyzed: appatta vīsati vassaḥ
translated: less than twenty years have passed since his mother gave birth to him.

original: “Upasampādessāmī”ti gaṇaṁ vā ācariyaṁ vā pattaṁ vā cīvaraṁ vā pariyesati, sīmaṁ vā sammannati, āpatti dukkaṭassa.🔽Ñattiyā dukkaṭaṁ.🔽Dvīhi kammavācāhi dukkaṭā.
analyzed: upasampādessāmi iti gaṇam vā ācariyam vā pattam vā cīvaram vā pariyesati sīmam vā sammannati āpatti dukkaṭassa  ñattiyā dukkaṭa  dvīhi kamma vācāhi dukkaṭā
translated: If, intending to give the full ordination, he searches for a group, a teacher, a bowl, or a robe, or he establishes a monastery zone, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.🔽After the motion, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

analyzed: kamma vācā pariyosāne upajjhāyassa āpatti pācittiyassa
translated: After each of the first two announcements, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.🔽When the last announcement is finished, the preceptor commits an offense entailing confession.

original: Gaṇassa ca ācariyassa ca āpatti dukkaṭassa.
analyzed: gaṇassa ca ācariyassa ca āpatti dukkaṭassa
translated: The group and the teacher commit an offense of wrong conduct.

analyzed: ūnavīsati vasse ūnavīsati vassa saññī upasampādeti āpatti pācittiyassa
translated: If the other is less than twenty years old, and the monk perceives them as less, and he gives them the full ordination, he commits an offense entailing confession.

original: Ūnavīsativasse vematiko upasampādeti, āpatti dukkaṭassa.🔽Ūnavīsativasse paripuṇṇavīsativassasaññī upasampādeti, anāpatti.
analyzed: ūnavīsati vasse vematikaḥ upasampādeti āpatti dukkaṭassa  ūnavīsati vasse paripuṇṇa vīsati vassa saññī upasampādeti anāpatti
translated: If the other is less than twenty years old, but the monk is unsure of it, and he gives them the full ordination, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.🔽If the other is less than twenty years old, but the monk perceives them as more, and he gives them the full ordination, there is no offense.

original: Paripuṇṇavīsativasse ūnavīsativassasaññī, āpatti dukkaṭassa.🔽Paripuṇṇavīsativasse vematiko, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
analyzed: paripuṇṇa vīsati vasse ūnavīsati vassa saññī āpatti dukkaṭassa  paripuṇṇa vīsati vasse vematikaḥ āpatti dukkaṭassa
translated: If the other is more than twenty years old, but the monk perceives them as less, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.🔽If the other is more than twenty years old, but the monk is unsure of it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

analyzed: paripuṇṇa vīsati vasse paripuṇṇa vīsati vassa saññī anāpatti
translated: If the other is more than twenty years old, and the monk perceives them as more, there is no offense.

analyzed: anāpatti  ūnavīsati vassam paripuṇṇa vīsati vassa saññī upasampādeti
translated: There is no offense if🔽the other is less than twenty years old, but the monk perceives them as more, and he gives them the full ordination;

analyzed: paripuṇṇa vīsati vassam paripuṇṇa vīsati vassa saññī upasampādeti
translated: if the other is more than twenty years old, and the monk perceives them as more, and he gives them the full ordination;

analyzed: ummattakassa
translated: if he is insane;

analyzed: ādikammikassa ati 🔽ūnavīsati vassa sikkhāpadam niṭṭhitam pañcama
translated: if he is the first offender.🔽The training rule on less than twenty years old, the fifth, is finished.
